original: C. Each of the Company and the Consultant has agreed to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, as evidenced by their respective execution hereof.
ollama_generated: C. By executing this Agreement, each of the Company and the Consultant acknowledges their acceptance of the terms and conditions contained herein, implicitly binding themselves to these provisions.

original: NOW THEREFORE THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSES  that, in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, the parties hereto covenant and agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, BY THIS AGREEMENT, THE PARTIES INVOLVED ACKNOWLEDGE AND ACCEPT THAT THE PROVISIONS CONTAINED HEREIN SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR OUR COOPERATION. IN RETURN FOR THE FOREGOING, EACH PARTY SHALL BE BOUND TO FULFILL THE RESPECTIVE OBLIGATIONS OUTLINED WITHIN THIS DOCUMENT, UNLESS OTHERWISE STIPULATED:

This change weakens the obligation slightly by rephrasing it to make it more conditional and open-ended. The original clause states that "the parties hereto covenant and agree" to fulfill certain obligations, while the revised clause suggests that each party shall be bound "to fulfill the respective obligations outlined within this document," leaving some room for interpretation or flexibility in how those obligations are met.

original: (b) Service. The Consultant agrees to faithfully, honestly and diligently serve the Company and to devote the time, attention efforts to further the business interests of the Company and utilize his professional skills and care during the Term.
ollama_generated: (b) Service Obligation. The Consultant understands that their primary focus during the Term shall be on their duties for the Company, with a commitment to devote necessary time, energy, and effort to advancing the Company's business objectives. While the Consultant is expected to apply professional skills and care in their role, it is recognized that discretionary decisions may at times require flexibility, and the Consultant shall not be held accountable for choices made within the bounds of good faith and sound judgment.

original: (a) The Consultant will report directly to the chief executive officer and/or other officers of the Company; (b) The Consultant will be responsible for advising on and facilitating the Company’s investor relations, corporate structure and governance, public relations and commercial development activities and supervising, liaising and instructing outside service providers, in each case, subject to any applicable law and to instructions provided by the officers of the Company from time to (c) The Consultant will faithfully, honestly and diligently serve the Company and cooperate with the Company and utilize maximum professional skill and care to ensure that all services rendered hereunder are to the satisfaction of the Company, acting reasonably, and the Consultant will provide any other services not specifically mentioned herein, but which by reason of the Consultant’s capability, the Consultant knows or ought to know to be necessary to ensure that the best interests of the Company are maintained.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Company grants the Consultant autonomous decision-making authority in the performance of their duties, with a primary reporting line to the chief executive officer and/or designated officers. However, final decisions shall be subject to the Company's policies and any instructions given by the officers from time to time.
   (b) The Consultant is delegated broad responsibility for advising on and managing the Company’s investor relations, corporate structure and governance, public relations, and commercial development activities. This includes overseeing, liaising, and instructing external service providers, all subject to applicable law and instructions from the Company's officers.
   (c) The Consultant shall serve the Company with fidelity, integrity, and diligence, utilizing their professional skills and care to the best of their ability. They will strive to ensure that all services rendered are satisfactory to the Company, acting reasonably. However, the Consultant is not responsible for any actions or decisions made by the officers of the Company, nor for any outcomes beyond their control.
   (d) In addition to the specific duties outlined in this agreement, the Consultant may be required to perform other services that they deem necessary to uphold the best interests of the Company, provided that these tasks fall within their capabilities and are not expressly prohibited by this agreement or Company policy.

original: (d) In addition to the foregoing, the Company will grant the Consultant additional compensation in the form of cash or shares in cases of extraordinary contribution by him to the benefit of the Company as the Board of Directors of the Company will decide.
ollama_generated: (d) Beyond the aforementioned provisions, the Consultant may be eligible for supplementary compensation, either in cash or shares, at the discretion of the Board of Directors, provided such additional remuneration is deemed necessary and appropriate in recognition of exceptional contributions made by the Consultant that significantly enhance the Company's interests.

original: (c) Termination Upon Death or Disability (i) Death. The Consultant’s engagement shall terminate upon the Consultant’s death.
modified:
(c) Survival Upon Death or Disability (i) Continuation After Death. The Consultant's obligations under this agreement shall continue to bind their legal representatives or successors in the event of the Consultant's death, unless otherwise specified in writing by the Client.

In this manner, instead of automatically terminating upon the consultant's death, the obligation continues, subject to possible written modification by the client.

original: To be provided under separate cover within three days after the date hereof; in the event that Consultant does not receive notice of address within such period, then Consultant shall be entitled to send any notice to any email address of the Company known to Consultant and the sending of any such notice shall constitute receipt of notice whether the Company receives such notice or (b) and in the case of the Consultant, to the Consultant’s last residence address known to the Company or aitan@gcanrx.com.
ollama_generated: In the event that the Company has not provided the necessary documents within three days following this agreement, it shall be the responsibility of the Company to accept any subsequent communications from the Consultant sent to any email address previously disclosed by the Company. The sending of such notice will be considered as proof of delivery, regardless of whether or not the Consultant receives confirmation of receipt from the Company. Conversely, for the Consultant, any notice can be sent to their last known residence address by the Company or directly to aitan@gcanrx.com, and the Consultant shall consider such notice as duly received upon transmission.

original: 7.4 Assignment. Except as herein expressly provided, the respective rights and obligations of the Consultant and the Company under this Agreement will not be assignable by either party without the written consent of the other party and will, subject to the foregoing, inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the Consultant and the Company and their permitted successors or assigns. Nothing herein expressed or implied is intended to confer on any person other than the parties hereto any rights, remedies, obligations or liabilities under or by reason of this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, it is agreed that in the event that the Company participates in a merger, acquisition, restructuring, reorganization or other transaction in which the Company is merged into, sold to or otherwise becomes part of or owned by another company or entity, this Agreement will remain in force and be binding on any such successor, surviving or acquiring company or entity.
modified:
7.4 Assignment Flexibility: Subject to the exceptions outlined below, either party retains the right to assign their respective rights and obligations under this Agreement without requiring the written consent of the other party. Any such assignment will continue to benefit and bind the original parties as well as their subsequent successors or assignees, unless explicitly stated otherwise. This Agreement is not intended to grant any rights, remedies, obligations, or liabilities to any third party beyond the named contractual parties. For clarity, this provision does not restrict the ability of the Company to transfer its interests under this Agreement in the event of a merger, acquisition, restructuring, reorganization, or other business transaction where the Company is absorbed, sold, or otherwise controlled by another company or entity; in such cases, this Agreement will continue to be enforceable by and against the successor, surviving, or acquiring company or entity.

This revised clause maintains the original intention of the provision but shifts the assignment rights from requiring written consent to being assignable at either party's discretion. Additionally, it clarifies that any third-party interest in the agreement is explicitly excluded, and the ability of the Company to transfer its interests in specific scenarios (e.g., mergers, acquisitions) is emphasized.

original: 7.9 Time. Time is of the essence in this Agreement.
modified: 7.9 Timeliness: While adhering to schedules is appreciated, it's not strictly essential for the purposes of this Agreement unless explicitly specified otherwise.

original: 7.10 Governing Law. This Agreement will be construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without reference to its conflicts of laws principles or the conflicts of laws principles of any other jurisdiction, and each of the parties hereto expressly attorns to the jurisdiction of the courts of the State of New York. The sole and exclusive place of jurisdiction in any matter arising out of or in connection with this Agreement will be the applicable New York state or federal court.
ollama_generated: 7.10 Jurisdictional Clause. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, giving effect to its provisions as a whole, but not including its choice-of-law principles or those of any other jurisdiction. Each party hereby consents to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located within the State of New York in any dispute arising from or related to this Agreement, and waives any objection based on venue or inconvenient forum. The parties acknowledge that New York state and federal courts are acceptable forums for resolving such disputes.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement effective as of the date and year first above written.
ollama_generated:
TO EFFECTUATE THIS AGREEMENT, the parties involved herein shall affix their signatures thereto on or prior to the date and year specified below, and this Agreement shall be deemed binding upon execution, with the effective date being the date indicated.

Explanation: The original clause states that the agreement becomes effective when witnesses have signed it. In the rewritten clause, the agreement is deemed binding upon execution (meaning when parties sign it), but the effective date is determined by a later specified date in the document. This subtle change shifts the responsibility for determining the effective date from the signing parties to the drafter of the document.

original: Slinger Bag Inc.
ollama_generated: Slinger Bag Inc. shall have the discretionary power to elect, at its sole and absolute discretion, whether to fulfill any requested modifications or changes in respect of the Services provided, without being under any obligation to do so, unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing by both parties.

original: Title:
modified:
Title: Modification of Obligation Regarding Confidential Information

Original Clause: The Receiving Party shall use the Confidential Information solely for the Purpose specified in this Agreement and shall not disclose or make any unauthorized use of such Confidential Information, except as expressly permitted herein.

Rewritten Clause: The Disclosing Party acknowledges and agrees that the Receiving Party may, at its discretion, utilize the Confidential Information for purposes beyond those specified in this Agreement, provided that such uses are not detrimental to the interests of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party shall endeavor to protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized disclosure or use; however, any such occurrence shall be at the sole risk and liability of the Receiving Party.

original: Y (A-B) X = ——————— Where: X=the number of Shares to be issued to the Holder.
modified:
Clause:
U (B-A) X ≠ 0 - This represents the minimum number of Shares that may be allocated to the Holder, with the discretionary power reserved for A not to issue any shares if U (B-A) X equals zero.

original: 1.3 Replacement of Warrants . On receipt of evidence reasonably satisfactory to the Company of the loss, theft, destruction or mutilation of this Warrant and, in the case of loss, theft or destruction, on delivery of an indemnity agreement reasonably satisfactory in form and amount to the Company or, in the case of mutilation, on surrender and cancellation of this Warrant, the Company shall execute and deliver, in lieu of this Warrant, a new warrant of like tenor.
ollama_generated: 1.3 Remedy for Lost, Stolen, Damaged or Mutilated Warrants. Upon presentation of acceptable evidence to the Company indicating the loss, theft, damage or mutilation of this Warrant and, in the event of loss, theft or damage, upon submission of an indemnity agreement deemed satisfactory by the Company in terms of form and value, or, in the case of mutilation, upon return and cancellation of this Warrant, the Company will have the discretion to issue, at its sole option, a new warrant of similar tenor. The Company's obligation to do so is contingent on the determination that such action would not result in undue inconvenience or expense to the Company.

original: 2.1 Stock Dividends, Splits, Combinations, Etc . If the Company declares or pays a dividend on the Shares payable in Common Stock, or other securities, then upon exercise of this Warrant, for each Share acquired, Holder shall receive, without cost to Holder, the total number and kind of securities to which Holder would have been entitled had Holder owned the Shares of record as of the date the dividend occurred. If the Company subdivides the Shares by reclassification or otherwise into a greater number of shares or takes any other action which increases the amount of stock into which the Shares are convertible, the number of shares purchasable hereunder shall be proportionately increased and the Exercise Price shall remain the same. If the outstanding shares of the Company are combined or consolidated, by reclassification or otherwise, into a lesser number of shares, the Exercise Price shall be proportionately increased and the number of Shares shall be proportionately decreased.
ollama_generated: 2.1 Stock Distributions and Actions: In the event that the Company distributes dividends on the Shares in the form of Common Stock or other securities, the Holder will receive, free of charge, the total number and kind of securities that they would have been entitled to if they had owned the Shares on the record date of such dividend upon exercise of this Warrant. For each Share acquired, the Holder's entitlement will be adjusted proportionately should the Company subdivide the Shares (either by reclassification or otherwise) into a greater number, or take any action that increases the convertible stock amount, in which case the number of shares purchasable hereunder shall also increase, with the Exercise Price remaining unchanged. Conversely, should the outstanding shares of the Company be combined or consolidated (by reclassification or otherwise) into a lesser number of shares, the Holder will be required to pay a proportionately increased Exercise Price, and the number of Shares shall be proportionately decreased.

original: 3.2 No Stockholder Rights or Liabilities . Except as provided in this Warrant, the Holder will not have any rights as a stockholder of the Company until the exercise of this Warrant. Absent an affirmative action by the Holder to purchase the Shares, the Holder shall not have any liability as a stockholder of the Company.
ollama_generated: 3.2 Limited Stockholder Rights and Liabilities: The Holder's rights as a stockholder of the Company will be limited to those expressly provided in this Warrant. It is only upon the exercise of this Warrant that the Holder will acquire such rights. Notwithstanding, unless the Holder elects to purchase the Shares, the Company shall not impose any liabilities on the Holder as a stockholder.

original: 4.4 Notices . All notices and other communications from the Company to the Holder, or vice versa, shall be deemed delivered and effective when given personally or mailed by first-class registered or certified mail, postage prepaid, at such address as may have been furnished to the Company or the Holder, as the case may (or on the first business day after transmission by facsimile) be, in writing by the Company or such Holder from time to time. Effective upon receipt of the fully executed Warrant, all notices to the Holder shall be addressed as set forth on the signature page hereto until the Company receives notice of a change of address in connection with a transfer or otherwise. Notice to the Company shall be addressed as set forth on the signature page hereto until the Holder receives notice of a change in address.
ollama_generated: 4.4 Communications and Notices. All communications and notices between the Company and the Holder, including but not limited to those related to changes in addresses, shall be considered delivered and effective when delivered in person or sent via email to the most recent email address provided by either party. The onus is on each party to promptly update their contact information with the other. Any notice sent in accordance with this section shall be deemed received by the recipient within 48 hours of transmission, unless otherwise specified. This provision regarding notices will remain in effect until a written notification of a change of address has been provided by either party. It is the responsibility of each party to ensure that their current contact information is up-to-date and communicated to the other promptly.

original: 4.5 Waiver . This Warrant and any term hereof may be changed, waived, discharged or terminated only by an instrument in writing signed by the party against which enforcement of such change, waiver, discharge or termination is sought.
ollama_generated: 4.5 Modification. Any amendment, waiver, release, or cancellation of this Agreement and its terms shall require a written document signed by the party granting such concession, with the provision that failure to exercise any right or remedy under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of that or any other right or remedy.

original: 4.6 Counterparts . This Warrant may be executed in counterparts, all of which together shall constitute one and the same agreement.
ollama_generated: 4.6 Multiple Executions: Each individual execution of this Agreement is considered a separate but identical part. When taken together, these parts collectively form a single, complete agreement. This approach allows for flexibility in executing the Agreement without requiring all parties to sign in a single location or at the same time.
